Description: Leather manuscript in Coptic containing magical spells for favor, honour and passion. Fragments of a tall, very narrow sheet of sheepskin leather (top and bottom without direct joint). remains of three recipes from a formulary
Curator's comments: reg nos are 1868, 1102.460 and 463. DADB: 291549001 and 291551001. According to Crum EA 10376, 10122, 10414, 10434, 10391 were written by the same hand and were probably acquired by Hay at Thebes (1934, p. 51 and 195). See now O'Connell ed. 2022 EA 10414a and b were previously mounted together.
Bibliographic references: Crum 1934 / Magical texts in Coptic I and II (pp. 199-200)
Meyer & Smith 1994 / Ancient Christian magic: Coptic texts of ritual power (no. 80, pp. 169-70)
O'Connell ed. 2022 / The Hay Archive of Coptic Spells on Leather: A Multidisciplinary Approach to the Materiality of Magical Practice (no. 5, pp. 157-168)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Leather: dark, fractured, fragmentary Black ink Tabbed: glassine paper Transferred to horizontal storage 27 JAN 95 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: poor
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 9 A.9 (typscript on sticker on glass of previous mount)
